comment.author: 93183605@N07
comment._content: Parliament Building, Molesworth Street, Thorndon, Wellington, NZ. Statue of Richard John Seddon, NZ Prime Minister from 1893 to 1906. Date looks incorrect: The building was designed by architects, John Campbell and Claude Paton, to replace the previous building that was destroyed by fire in 1907. Foundation stone laid in 1912. "Outbreak of the First World War slowed progress on construction and when, in 1918, the House of Representatives was first used it was dedicated as a memorial to those who had lost their lives in the war." Building was not 'finished' until 1922 (another wing had been designed but was not built). Sources: NZ Historic Places Trust Register No. 223 www.historic.org.nz/TheRegister/RegisterSearch/RegisterRe... NZ Parliament www.parliament.nz/en-NZ/AboutParl/HstBldgs/Buildings/Grou... For a contemporary view see: www.tikitouring.co.nz/images/wellington-parliament.jpg

comment.author: 93183605@N07
comment._content: Bronze statue of Seddon wasn't erected until 1915. It was designed by Sir Thomas Brock of England. Source: www.parliament.nz/en-NZ/Features/7/9/0/00NZPHomeNews15052...

comment.author: 91842374@N00
comment._content: You can see the Wellington Cenotaph being built in the background. It was used for the first time in 1931 so is probably closer to that date. www.nzhistory.net.nz/media/photos/wellington-cenotaphwell...
